titleInfo.title: USA v. Abston et al
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Frank James Abston (1), Count 1 - Imprisonment: LIFE w/recommendation to BOP that dft be imprisoned at an institution where a residential, comprehensive, substance abuse treatment program is available; SRT: 10 years w/special condition that dft participate in a program of testing & treatment for drug &/or alcohol abuse as directed by the Probation Office; SA: $100.00. Count 2 - Dismissed on motion of the government. Signed by Judge Callie V. S. Granade on 7/11/2012. (tot)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 1:11-cr-00238; USA v. Abston et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Southern District of Alabama
extension.docketText: JUDGMENT as to Frank James Abston (1), Count 1 - Imprisonment: LIFE w/recommendation to BOP that dft be imprisoned at an institution where a residential, comprehensive, substance abuse treatment program is available; SRT: 10 years w/special condition that dft participate in a program of testing & treatment for drug &/or alcohol abuse as directed by the Probation Office; SA: $100.00. Count 2 - Dismissed on motion of the government. Signed by Judge Callie V. S. Granade on 7/11/2012. (tot)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Abston et al
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Walter Lee Hodges, Jr. (2), Count 1 - Dismissed on motion of the government. Count 2 - Imprisonment: 67 months w/recommendation to BOP that dft be imprisoned at an institution where a residential, comprehensive, substance abuse treatment is available; SRT: 6 years w/special condition that dft shall participate in program of testing & treatment for drug &/or alcohol abuse as directed by the Probation Office; SA: $100.00. Signed by Judge Callie V. S. Granade on 7/11/2012. (tot)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 1:11-cr-00238; USA v. Abston et al;

Count 2 - Imprisonment: 67 months w/recommendation to BOP that dft be imprisoned at an institution where a residential, comprehensive, substance abuse treatment is available; SRT: 6 years w/special condition that dft shall participate in program of testing & treatment for drug &/or alcohol abuse as directed by the Probation Office; SA: $100.00. Signed by Judge Callie V. S. Granade on 7/11/2012. (tot)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Abston et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to Walter Lee Hodges Jr. GRANTING 180 Motion to Reduce Sentence re: 2014 Drug Guidelines Amendment. Dft's previously imposed sentence of imprisonment is reduced to 55 months, effective 11/1/15. Signed by Judge Callie V. S. Granade on 1/6/2015. (copy mailed to Dft on 1/6/15) (tot)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Abston et al
titleInfo.subTitle: REPORT AND RECOMMENDATION as to Frank James Abston recommending that Pet's 178 MOTION to Vacate under 28 U.S.C. 2255 be denied & that this action be dismissed as set out, & further recommending that any certificate of appealability filed by Pet be denied as he is not entitled to appeal in forma pauperis. Objections to R&R due by 4/22/2015. Signed by Magistrate Judge Bert W. Milling, Jr. on 4/2/2015. (copy mailed to Dft on 4/2/15) (tot)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 1:11-cr-00238; USA v. Abston et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Southern District of Alabama
extension.docketText: REPORT AND RECOMMENDATION as to Frank James Abston recommending that Pet's 178 MOTION to Vacate under 28 U.S.C. 2255 be denied & that this action be dismissed as set out, & further recommending that any certificate of appealability filed by Pet be denied as he is not entitled to appeal in forma pauperis. Objections to R&R due by 4/22/2015. Signed by Magistrate Judge Bert W. Milling, Jr. on 4/2/2015. (copy mailed to Dft on 4/2/15) (tot)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Abston et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to Frank James Abston ADOPTING 195 Report and Recommendation. Pet's 178 Motion to Vacate (2255) is DISMISSED, & it is ORDERED that any certificate of appealability filed by Pet be DENIED as he is not entitled to appeal in forma pauperis Signed by Judge Callie V. S. Granade on 6/8/2015. (copy mailed to Pet/Dft on 6/9/15) (tot) Civil Case 1:14-cv-00505-CG closed.
